column3: str
Oh, a new drone has fluttered into the Beehive! But are you sure that your patron won't mind?
Back for some more “High or Low,” are we? I knew you'd be unable to resist...

Oh my, you are a naughty one sneaking back in here just to see me. I heard you'd stirred up quite the hornet's nest. And you look ever so uneasy... How about a little game to relieve some of that tension?
I'm sorry, little drone... My head is all...foggy.
Though the world may be falling down around us, there's no reason to deprive ourselves of life's pleasures. Can I tempt you with a little game, my dear?
Most people buzz about during the day, whereas I am a creature of the night. After all, the best games are played after dark, wouldn't you agree?
What will you say?
Let's play “High or Low”!
Maybe another time.
What are the rules?
“High or Low” is a guessing game. You must decide whether the total of your three cards is higher or lower than the total of your opponent's cards.
The deck holds nine cards, with the pictures printed thereon representing the numbers one through nine. Each number appears only once in the deck, so there are no repeats.
If you guess correctly, then you win the match. If both totals are the same, then another hand is dealt.
Oh, you mustn't tease me like that... If you change your mind, my naughty little drone, I'll be waiting.
Come then, honeybee. Let's have some fun.
Three cards for you, three cards for me. You flip one of yours over, and I flip two of mine.
Now, what's your call? Will your total be higher or lower than mine?
I choose...
Low!
High!
You're going with “low,” then? Right, let's see what we've got...
You're going with “high,” then? Right, let's see what we've got...
My cards add up to <Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>. And you have...
...a total of <Value>IntegerParameter(1)</Value>.
Congratulations, your guess was right!
Well, it seems luck was on your side. Or perhaps it was more than that...
How does victory taste? Sweet as nectar, yes?
So, our little game ends with you on top...
Can I tempt you with another game?
Stay with me a while longer, my dear.
So you wish to end on a high note? Perfectly understandable.
Aw... Sorry, honeybee, but this match goes to me.
Shall we play again?
That's what I like to hear. Let me shuffle the deck...
Had enough for now? Fine, fine─I'll be sitting right here should the mood strike you.
Oho, it seems we came out equal. But as lovely a coincidence as that may be, we still need a clear winner...
